But now there's another mystery ... who wrote "Redfern NSW" on the Powerhouse's print?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The Second Sydney Station Terminus (1874) aka Redfern, on the left, see www.cityrail.info/about/history/central_station_in-depth

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Wow, this photo has proved very popular over at the PHM photostream!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Yes, but most of the hits over the last two years are from me, trying in vain to get  the PhM interested.

More seriously, I think the popularity is because the PhM is part of the Flickr "Commons", which I don't think State Records NSW subscribes to, probably due to copyright concerns.   What you lose in control, you gain in interest.  

eg Compare the stats on this image PhM -  
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2633077972/]

State Records NSW - 
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4886823424/]

Also 128,106+ views etc.! - 
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2980051095/]

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Yes, that is a massive difference in views. We did apply to join "The Commons" but at the time there was a four year waiting list!

AB

comment.author: 36666393@N08
comment._content: My Great Great Grandfather had his foundry and stove-making factory just across the road from here. It's great to have so much history in N.S.W. It's keeping me from moving to Queensland.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Thanks @David. All very confusing. I have been trying get PhM to change their Flickr map for years! And more importantly the wrong location leaked on to the ABC Sidelines educational site www.abc.net.au/innovation/sidetracks/map.htm . Misinformation spreading ... The PhM Tyrrell Collection version is the original glass negative (not a print). Some of the available prints have "REDFERN NSW" written on - some, like this one, don't. Someone must have stuck it on the negative after this copy was printed, but who? from.ph/351914

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: The fact that the Colonial Office has done the photographic review is really interesting. I'm coming to believe the 20th Anniversary of the opening of the line was the motivation. Do the albums reveal anything I wonder?
